comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: This is the 1915 pattern issue trench cap. The soldiers nicknamed them 'Gor Blimey' caps. There is a good picture of the design - one made in blue for distribution to PoWs in Germany - at www.iwm.org.uk/collections/item/object/30093164 PS/1858 Private James Burton was the son of Frances Campbell Burton, of 66 Leam Terrace, Leamington, Warwickshire, and the late George Burton. CWGC. The PS prefix indicated that 16th Battalion Middlesex was, originally at least, a 'Public Schools' battalion. 16th(Service) Battalion (Public Schools) was originally sent to France with 100th Brigade in 33rd Division. They landed at Boulogne on 17th November 1915, but in late February 1916 were transferred to a support role with GHQ Troops, before landing with 86th Brigade in 29th Division on 25th April 1916 for the Battle of the Somme. There is some, believed genuine but somewhat indistinct, film footage of 16th Battalion Middlesex attacking the 'Hawthorn Ridge' on 1st July 1916 at www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fm1eY7X343o //
